revised_title: Investigations on the Effect of Dilute Solutions of Bicarbonates and Acids on Assimilation by Submerged Plants
tldr: Researchers improved the bubble-counting method to measure carbon-assimilation in submerged plants. They investigated the effects of dilute mineral acids and bicarbonates on the rate of bubble formation. The study found that water plants cannot actively split bicarbonates in solution, and the bubble-counting method can be used to study the impact of various substances on plant assimilation.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Biology
